title: Boenasa tricolor
text:
Boenasa tricolor is a <a href="moth">moth</a> in the subfamily <a href="Arctiinae%20%28moth%29">Arctiinae</a> first described by <a href="Gottlieb%20August%20Wilhelm%20Herrich-Sch%C3%A4ffer">Gottlieb August Wilhelm Herrich-Schäffer</a> in 1866. It is found on <a href="Cuba">Cuba</a>.
The intensity of pink on the head, patagia and dorsum of the forewings is variable. In some specimens these areas are almost white.
